data.question: What is the chemical formula of the metal-organic polymer discussed?
What is the main application of the discussed metal-organic polymer?
What is the synthesis temperature for [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2?
How long is the synthesis process for [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2?
What is the yield percentage of [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2?
What color change occurs upon dehydration of [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2?
What happens to the color of the dehydrated material when exposed to atmospheric air?
data.answer: It immediately restores its original blue color

data.question: What is the activation temperature for CO oxidation over [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2?
At what temperature does [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2 reach 100% CO conversion?
What is the activation energy on [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2 for CO oxidation?
Is the catalytic activity of [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2 stable with time at a fixed temperature of 104 °C or higher?
Does the microporous framework of [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2 remain intact after removal of guest molecules?
Are the paddle-wheel Cu2 clusters at the channel walls the stable active sites for catalytic oxidation?
Does the elemental analysis of the material after catalytic reaction match the theoretical value of the dehydrated sample?
Is the CO adsorbed inside the cavity of the dehydrated [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2, not on the bulk surface?
Does the non-dehydrated [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2 show a similar CO adsorption property to the dehydrated form at room temperature?
Is the catalytic activity of [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2 higher than that of Ni-containing MOP at 200 °C?
What is the role of cyclic water tetramers in the structure of [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2?
data.answer: They aggregate into cyclic water tetramers through hydrogen-bonding interactions and form a 1D tube-like structure in the open channels.

data.question: What is the effect of dehydration on the color of [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2?
data.answer: Dehydration causes a color change from blue to black-violet.

data.question: Can the adsorbed CO on [Cu(mipt)(H2O)](H2O)2 be completely removed at 200 °C in vacuum?
